meanings.definition: people who are flat or lacking in depth
meanings.sent1: The flatlings in the story had no interesting characteristics.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting depicted a group of flatlings standing in a row.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, everyone dressed up as flatlings, wearing cardboard cutouts.
meanings.sent4: The classroom felt like a gathering of flatlings, devoid of any excitement or energy.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed a world where everyone was a flatling, living a monotonous existence.

meanings.sent1: The flatlings landscape stretched out endlessly before us.
meanings.sent2: The old book had flatlings characters that didn't evolve throughout the story.
meanings.sent3: The cake turned out flatlings, lacking the expected layers and flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her response to the question was flatlings, without any real thought or emotion.
meanings.sent5: The music sounded flatlings, missing the richness and complexity of a full orchestra.

meanings.definition: in a flat or shallow manner
meanings.sent1: She walked flatlings across the stage, not showing any enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: The paper was folded flatlings, making it easy to slip into the envelope.
meanings.sent3: He sang the song flatlings, without any variation in tone or pitch.
meanings.sent4: The boat glided flatlings on the calm lake, barely creating a ripple.
meanings.sent5: The ball rolled flatlings along the ground, never bouncing or veering off course.
